oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company Plant, Nashville, Tennessee, 1945 July 23
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of the 1945 construction site of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company Plant in Bordeaux, west of Nashville. This was a construction project of the Foster & Creighton General Contractors. The picture shows “construction progress on Plancor 2364 Goodyear Tennessee Co., Nashville, Tennessee at time work was stopped July 19, 1945.” The verso of the photo reads: “view looking South showing miscellaneous construction Rental Equipment and in the right foreground is face brick stock piled, and in the center of the picture is Temporary Building used as Saw Mill. In the right hand side of the picture is the general construction offices. Residence shown in the parking lot area, just left of center is owned by the R.F.C. and the Material Warehouse is shown in the background.” The project originated in a government contract between the construction firm and the U.S. Corps of Engineers. The Foster & Creighton construction contracting firm was founded in 1885 by Wilbur F. Foster and Robert T. Creighton, who had both served as City Engineer of Nashville. Forms part of the Foster & Creighton General Contractors Collection. 1 b & w photograph.
